subject: Re: [junit] Test Grouping/Partitioning
msgSnippet: ... FYI, TestNG also supports class-level annotations: @Test(groups = database ) public class DatabaseTests { } In this case, all the methods in this class
messageBody:
On 7/3/07, Christian Nelson <cnelson@...> wrote:

> What I really would like to see is the concept of suite (or group in
> TestNG terms) be promoted to a first class citizen. Honestly, I think
> I would prefer it to be at the test class level (unlike TestNG which
> is at the test method level),

FYI, TestNG also supports class-level annotations:

@Test(groups = "database")
public class DatabaseTests {
}

In this case, all the methods in this class will automatically be part
of the "database" groups.

You can also put this annotation on a base class, so that classes that
extend it automatically become part of that group as well (and in this
case, your test class becomes pretty much annotation free). Of
course, this also extends to all the attributes of the @Test
annotation, such as threadPoolSize, timeOut, invocationCount, etc...

--
Cédric
